pr_title: Fix STAsBinary to return WKB format instead of CLR

timeline.bodyText: tests should have a header briefly describing what the tests are testing
timeline.author: lilgreenbird

timeline.bodyText: all these testsBlah and testBlah2 tests are identical other than test data, can we refactor them to call a common test method instead?
timeline.author: lilgreenbird

timeline.bodyText: can we rename this, as initially I thought this was a hack to avoid @beforeeach. But actually this isn't called before each tests.
timeline.author: lilgreenbird

replies.bodyText: and, so if these table names are only used in the before each test which use them, then it shouldn't be in the @BeforeAll method right? (lines 2273-2275) Should move to this beforeEachSetup() method instead. And, can we do the escape quotes at the same time we're generating the names so we don't have to do it everywhere?
replies.author: lilgreenbird

timeline.bodyText: add a negative test for DW to make sure it throws the proper error
timeline.author: lilgreenbird

replies.bodyText: Well...we can't. Geometry/Geography are not supported datatypes against DW. We wouldn't be able to test it because we can't create a table with those column types.
replies.author: peterbae

replies.bodyText: that's what I mean, add a negative test that runs on DW and check that it will fail with the appropriate unsupported error msg
replies.author: lilgreenbird

replies.bodyText: That's not a negative test, that's just an unsupported scenario that shouldn't be concerned with the driver.
replies.author: peterbae

timeline.author: ulvii

timeline.bodyText: Is the returned value little endian only?
timeline.author: ulvii

replies.bodyText: For feature when we implement STGeomFromWKB, we should keep in mind that both values are possible when user provides WKB.
replies.author: ulvii

replies.bodyText: Yes. Returned value is little endian only (as SQL Server does). I will keep this in mind when the user provides WKB.
replies.author: peterbae

timeline.bodyText: Need to throw an exception here instead.
timeline.author: ulvii

timeline.bodyText: Same here and in a few other default cases below, instead of ignoring unexpected values, we should throw and exception.
timeline.author: ulvii

timeline.bodyText: Can you add comment explaining what this block does?
timeline.author: ulvii
ulvii

replies.bodyText: I've added comments to tests instead.
replies.author: peterbae

timeline.author: ulvii

replies.bodyText: why not take the suggestion above to rename all the testBlah2 tests to more meaningful names?
replies.author: lilgreenbird

replies.bodyText: I wanted to stick to numberings because geometrycollection has up to 50 different ones, but I'll change these to "empty" at the end since you insist.
replies.author: peterbae

timeline.bodyText: In all these tests, expected value should come first
timeline.author: ulvii
ulvii

replies.bodyText: No, the assertTrue is the part where the STAsBinary method (the one I'm adding) is getting tested, unless I misunderstood your question.
replies.author: peterbae

timeline.bodyText: Here and in some the tests above, please make sure expected value is first.
timeline.author: ulvii

replies.bodyText: My bad, I forgot these ones.
replies.author: peterbae

replies.bodyText: Actually, in this line, the expected value is coming first, right? I already swapped them this morning because you asked me to.
replies.author: peterbae

replies.bodyText: I missed that one. I'll swap to assertArrayEquals as well.
replies.author: peterbae
